name: Picante de la Casa
instructions:
1. Cut a small piece of chili (about ¼ inch wide) and press with muddler in the shaker tin.
2. Hand clap the cilantro (to release the aroma, place the leaves or sprig in one hand and gently smack it with the other – this warms up the garnish slightly and starts to extract the oils before you use it), and drop in.
3. Add the rest of the ingredients, shake and fine strain into an ice-filled rocks glass (a short tumbler used for serving spirits).
4. Cut off the top end  the chili pepper and place – stem upwards – on top.
description:
Lovers of the margarita, we have a treat for you here! The Picante de la Casa Cocktail, also called the Soho House Picante or Soho House Tonic, is a creation of the Soho House Club. That is a group of private members' clubs with its origin in Soho in the Londoner West End. The cocktail, however, does not have its roots in England but in West Hollywood, USA. -Although, actually, it looks like it could be straight out of Mexico.

Soho House have shared the recipe for their picante de la casa. The picante is based on the much-loved margarita, but the picante cocktail ingredients includes chilli and coriander – to add a little extra heat and spice. It is revelatory – and a drink you’ll be coming back to.
garnish: Top end (stem) of the chilli pepper

ingredients.name: Tequila Reposado
ingredients.description:
Tequila Reposado is a type of tequila that has been aged or "rested" in oak barrels for a specific period, giving it a mellower and more complex flavor compared to Tequila Blanco (unaged tequila). The term "reposado" translates to "rested" in Spanish.

Reposado occupies a middle ground between the youthful vibrancy of Blanco tequila and the more mature and complex characteristics of Añejo tequila. It appeals to those who appreciate a balance of agave flavor and the influence of oak aging.

ingredients.name: Agave Syrup
ingredients.description:
Agave syrup, also known as agave nectar, is a sweetener that is derived from the sap of the agave plant, primarily the blue agave plant native to Mexico. The syrup is a popular alternative to traditional sweeteners like sugar and honey, particularly in the context of natural and organic food products.

Agave syrup is praised for its sweetness and versatility. It is sweeter than sugar, so smaller amounts can be used to achieve the same level of sweetness. Additionally, it has a lower glycemic index compared to some other sweeteners, meaning it has a smaller impact on blood sugar levels.

Agave syrup has a mild, neutral flavor, making it suitable for a variety of culinary applications. It is commonly used as a sweetener in beverages, baked goods, and desserts. However, it's essential to note that agave syrup, like any sweetener, should be consumed in moderation due to its high fructose content.

substitutes.name: Honey Syrup
substitutes.description:
Honey syrup is a natural sweetener used in cocktails to add depth and complexity beyond what standard simple syrup offers. Made by diluting honey with water, usually in a 1:1 ratio, this syrup brings not only sweetness but also subtle floral, herbal, or fruity notes depending on the type of honey used.

When incorporating honey syrup into drinks, it's important to consider its distinct flavor profile. The type of honey used can significantly impact the final taste of the cocktail, allowing for creative variations. Bartenders often prefer to make their own honey syrup to control the consistency and flavor, though commercial versions are available. As with other syrups, the amount used can be adjusted to balance the cocktail's sweetness with other components.

ingredients.name: Lime juice
ingredients.description:
Lime juice is a key player in the world of cocktails, renowned for its bright, sharp, and slightly sweeter flavor compared to lemon juice. Extracted from fresh limes, this citrus juice adds a vibrant, zesty kick to drinks, making it an indispensable ingredient in many classic and contemporary cocktails.


When using lime juice in cocktails, freshly squeezed is highly recommended for its superior taste and aroma. The amount used can vary depending on the recipe, but even a small quantity can significantly brighten and enliven a drink. Its versatility allows it to pair well with a wide range of spirits, from tequila and rum to gin and vodka.

ingredients.name: Chilli Pepper
ingredients.description: Chili peppers are known for their pungent and spicy flavor, attributed to the compound capsaicin. They come in various shapes, sizes, and colors, ranging from mild to extremely hot varieties.

ingredients.name: Cilantro
ingredients.description:
An annual herb in the family Apiaceae. All parts of the plant are edible, but the fresh leaves and the dried seeds are the parts most traditionally used in cooking.

Most people perceive coriander as having a tart, lemon/lime taste, but to some individuals the leaves taste like dish soap. The perception of a soapy taste in certain aldehydes is linked to a specific gene.
